channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16768] Inconsistent results from the Append/Increment
item.description:
If the Append/Increment skips the WAL, the sequential id will not be updated.
It introduces that the AbstractMemStore#upsert may remove the cell even though the cell is visible to the oldest scanner.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.
Ugly one. Good find. We have to iterate twice? This is a branch-1 only issue? Thanks ChiaPing Tsai
As the older comment says getting seqID is expensive should you do the for loop thing only if you are sure the WAL is being skipped rather than every time Append/increment is performed?

hi stack

We have to iterate twice?

That is ugly code... i will fix it.

This is a branch-1 only issue?

master have this issue also.

Thanks for your review.

hi Ramkrishna.S.Vasudevan

Copy that. But it should be cheaper for getting seqID, the method just returns a long value.

Thansk for your comment.

But it should be cheaper for getting seqID, the method just returns a long value.

Yes I can see that.
But better to avoid still because in one of our internal changes we were seeing if we can add a Cell that does append the seqid in the backing byte[] itself. In that case it could be costly to parse it from the cell every time. But that is not there now in trunk anyway.

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan

Thank for your explanation.

4503	  private List<Result> doAppend(final boolean walUsed) throws IOException {

4504	    LOG.info("Starting testAppend");

4505	    final TableName TABLENAME = TableName.valueOf("testAppendWithoutWAL");

The table name should reflect whether WAL is used, depending on the boolean flag.
address stack, Ted Yu, and ramkrishna.s.vasudevan's comments.

638	  public long add(final Iterable<Cell> cells) {

639	    lock.readLock().lock();

Why is read lock taken instead of the write lock ?

I follow the logic of HStore#add(cell) which uses the read lock also.

According to the comments in HStore, the MemStore is assumed to be thread safe. So it use the read lock.

I see.

+1 from me.

Mind attaching patch for branch-1 ?

Thanks
ok
